p: Bovine mastitis is one of the most prevalent problem which affects dairy herd production worldwide, and antimicrobial therapy is the primary tool for the treatment. This disease is responsible for a negative effect in the economy of several countries, because of the decrease results in the production level and quality of milk. The most frequent pathogen which caused subclinical mastitis in dairy cows is Staphylococcus aureus ( 1). This microorganism is characterized by its capacity of select resistance against traditional antimicrobials and some virulence factors as its ability to form biofilms and to invade and survive inside epithelial cells ( 2).
